Astarion_ROM_Act2.synopsis: Act 2 romance banter between Minthara and Astarion

Shadowheart_Rivington.synopsis: Minthara and Shadowheart discuss refugees and exiles

Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue.synopsis: Astarion and Minthara talk in Moonrise, after the fall of Ketheric

Laezel_Lodge.synopsis: Minthara and Lae'zel comment on the Society of Brilliance

Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks.synopsis: Minthara comments on the smokepowder used to make fireworks, Shadowheart responds

Laezel_BasiliskGate.synopsis: Minthara and Lae'zel comment on the general sense of disorder in the city

Laezel_LastLightProtected.synopsis: Lae'zel and Minthara talk about survivors sheltering in Last Light

Shadowheart_SorcerousSundries.synopsis: Minthara comments on items in Sorcerous Sundries, Shadowheart responds

Karlach_AbandonedCistern.synopsis: Minthara and Karlach explore the sewers beneath Baldur's Gate

Shadowheart_Wyrmway.synopsis: Minthara and Shadowheart talk in an underground dungeon

Astarion_LastLightCursed.synopsis: Astarion and Minthara see Last Light, fallen into shadow

Astarion_CazadorsPalace.synopsis: Astarion and Minthara explore Cazador's palace

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: Would you ever consider sharing the gift of immortality with me, Astarion?

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: I think not. That is for me and my darling to share.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: If they have prevented your eyes and fangs from wandering to other necks, it must be a special bond indeed.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_ROM_Act2_0.text: Half the men of Menzoberranzan are pleasure-servants. Weaklings, whose beauty is their only redeeming quality.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_ROM_Act2_2.text: You would fit right in with them, Astarion.
Astarion_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: mocking Astarion, trying to get a rise out of him

Astarion_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act2_1.text: You think I'm beautiful? Oh, Minthara.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.text: I cannot tell if you are more a deviant or a debutante, Shadowheart.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.text: I would like to test both aspects of your character when next you find yourself alone at night.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.text: I'm not quite sure I like where this is going.

Party_GortashAlliance_1.speaker: Player
Party_GortashAlliance_1.text: |Nothing ventured, Nothing gained. We could have gotten much, much more out of that particular confrontation|

Party_GortashAlliance_3.speaker: Player
Party_GortashAlliance_3.text: |We got access to the city didn't we? That's more than we had when we entered the ceremony.|

Party_GortashAlliance_2.speaker: Player
Party_GortashAlliance_2.text: |We walked out of that meeting with much more than we entered with|

Party_GortashAlliance_5.speaker: Player
Party_GortashAlliance_5.text: |Are you sure about that? We made an alliance with the enemy.|

Emperor_Laezel_BaldursGate_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Emperor_Laezel_BaldursGate_0.text: Our illithid warns us away from what lies beyond that gate, but perhaps it underestimates us.

Emperor_Laezel_BaldursGate_2.speaker: The Emperor
Emperor_Laezel_BaldursGate_2.text: You should listen to your illithid. It knows your weaknesses as well as it knows the brain's strengths.

Emperor_Laezel_BaldursGate_1.speaker: Astarion
Emperor_Laezel_BaldursGate_1.text: Care to share any of Minthara's weaknesses? Or would it take too long to go through them all?

Emperor_Laezel_BaldursGate_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Emperor_Laezel_BaldursGate_3.text: Watch your tongue, spawn. I need the illithid alive - you are expendable.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_002_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Wyll_ROM_Act3_002_1.text: Your devilish patron is a delight, Wyll. Have you ever lain with her?

Wyll_ROM_Act3_002_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_002_0.text: I'm really not that kind of man.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_002_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Wyll_ROM_Act3_002_2.text: She will see her failure to seduce you as a stain on her honour. I know I would.

PAD_GortashCeremony_2.speaker: Player
PAD_GortashCeremony_2.text: |Gortash appears to have worked the people in a way that I've only ever seen accomplished in Menzoberranzan|

PAD_GortashCeremony_0.speaker: Player
PAD_GortashCeremony_0.text: |That sounds like admiration. A rare thing to come from you|

Shadowheart_Rivington_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_Rivington_1.text: The excess of refugees outside the city walls could easily become a surplus of labourers.

Shadowheart_Rivington_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Rivington_2.text: Careful, Minthara. As a drow exile, you could be classed as a refugee yourself. Not volunteering, I take it?

Shadowheart_Rivington_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_Rivington_0.text: I am a daughter of House Baenre. I obey no authority except my own desires.

Shadowheart_Rivington_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Rivington_3.text: I can think of a least one wriggly stowaway who might dispute that...
Shadowheart_Rivington_3.context: NodeContext: referring to Minthara's tadpole and its potential to control her

Astarion_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_ROM_Act3_0.text: Are you a better man now that you are loved, Astarion? Did they mend your ways?

Astarion_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_1.text: I rather think they did. Can't imagine anyone wanting to do that for you, though dear.

Astarion_SCLForest_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_SCLForest_1.text: The shadows have lingered here so long, the land itself is corroded. A most persistent curse.

Astarion_SCLForest_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_SCLForest_2.text: I think I know a thing or two about persistent curses, thank you.

Astarion_SCLForest_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_SCLForest_0.text: The rashes and sores you may have contracted over your decades of philandering are not the kind of curse that concerns me.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_002_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Karlach_ROM_Act3_002_1.text: Have you ever been afraid, Karlach? Truly afraid?

Karlach_ROM_Act3_002_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_002_0.text: You know how much time I spent in the hells, right? Of course I've been scared!

Karlach_ROM_Act3_002_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_002_2.text: I kept on going though. Knew there'd be better days on the other side - and here they are.

Gale_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Gale_ROM_Act3_0.text: Do you have elder siblings, wizard?

Gale_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_2.text: You're about to say something awful, aren't you?
Gale_ROM_Act3_2.context: NodeContext: Hint of dread - if Minthara's enjoying something, it's rarely good for Gale

Gale_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Gale_ROM_Act3_1.text: In Menzoberranzan, after a house has two sons, every subsequent male-born child is slaughtered at birth, as it is useless, even for breeding.

Gale_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Gale_ROM_Act3_3.text: You have the aura of a third child about you.

Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue_1.text: Did you expect to survive Myrkul's wrath, little spawn?
Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue_1.context: NodeContext: Inquisitive - talking to Astarion. Myrkul is a god of death (MER-kul).

Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue_0.text: You'd be surprised, drow. I've survived a lot of things.

Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue_2.text: Greater horrors await us in Baldur's Gate. Best sharpen your fangs.
Astarion_MoonriseEpilogue_2.context: NodeContext: She's looking forward to the challenge. Condescending toward Astarion

Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.text: A few pointers, Lae'zel. I heard you and your lover locked in combat, but the test you set was not rigorous enough.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.text: Next time, tie them to the ground, and do not release them until you are both satisfied.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.text: Hmm. You have given me ideas...

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: You fight harder than ever now that you have a lover to protect from harm, Lae'zel.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: The githyanki should encourage relations between their soldiers. It is a proven tactic for morale.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: We need no boon for morale - I fight well when there is kin at my side. And now, I count one more among them.

Laezel_Lodge_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_Lodge_3.text: The Society of Brilliance! These preposterous fools love to meddle in Underdark affairs - they are most amusing.
Laezel_Lodge_3.context: NodeContext: first phrase, she's exclaiming rather than shouting - amused to have found the Society, having heard much about it.

Laezel_Lodge_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_Lodge_2.text: They seek to promote peace between species through mutual understanding. Ha.
Laezel_Lodge_2.context: NodeContext: She finds this concept hilarious. The laugh is a short bark.

Laezel_Lodge_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Lodge_1.text: Even my people know the value of a carefully crafted coalition, Minthara. Is our own alliance not a case in point?

Gale_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.text: You've been smiling like a fool of late, wizard. Explain yourself.

Gale_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_1.text: I've found love. Surely even you wouldn't begrudge me some happiness.
Gale_ROM_Act2_1.context: NodeContext: Stroppy, defending himself after Minthara hit a nerve

Gale_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Gale_ROM_Act2_0.text: All I will say on the matter is that you were wise to lower your standards from the godly to the ghastly.

Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_2.text: Amusing as it is to provide children with such lethal toys, surely there are better uses for this powder?
Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_2.context: NodeContext: speaking about smokepowder (similar to gunpowder) after seeing some fireworks

Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_0.text: Plenty. They can make for excellent distractions, should you need to make a quick exit.

Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_1.text: Partly why the Ducal Council controls supply - trying to keep the whizz-bangs out of nefarious hands.

Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_FelogyrsFireworks_3.text: The Ducal Council must have sprung a leak, for we seem to find barrels of the stuff everywhere.

Laezel_BasiliskGate_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_BasiliskGate_2.text: There is no true authority in this city. The guards are more degenerate than the criminals.
Laezel_BasiliskGate_2.context: NodeContext: haughty, despairing at the mess of it all

Laezel_BasiliskGate_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_BasiliskGate_0.text: True warriors among the city's Flaming Fist seem exceedingly rare. The worst are mere rats scurrying about their warren.

Laezel_BasiliskGate_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_BasiliskGate_1.text: And what do we do with rats, Lae'zel? We hang them by the tails, and burn their warrens.
Laezel_BasiliskGate_1.context: NodeContext: a wonderful life lesson from Minthara, who is proudly teaching Lae'zel how to deal with 'rats' - in this case, the city guards, who she hates

Laezel_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_MorphicPool_0.text: We drow are sensitive to psionic power. And this place throbs with mental power such as I have never known.

Laezel_MorphicPool_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_MorphicPool_1.text: It threatens all of us, gith and mud worlder alike. But even the brightest blaze can be extinguished.

Laezel_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_MorphicPool_2.text: Extinguish it? I intend to seize it. Power exists to be wielded.

Laezel_LastLightProtected_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_LastLightProtected_2.text: These people seem soldiers by their bearing. What say you, Lae'zel?

Laezel_LastLightProtected_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_LastLightProtected_1.text: The enforcers of order - unmistakable in their vigilant bearing. So it goes across all the planes and their peoples.

Laezel_LastLightProtected_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_LastLightProtected_0.text: On this plane, the story always ends the same way. Order collapses, and shadows take the light.

Shadowheart_SorcerousSundries_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_SorcerousSundries_2.text: I must admit, some of the items here are quite marvellous.
Shadowheart_SorcerousSundries_2.context: NodeContext: impressed by the selection in a magic tiem store

Shadowheart_SorcerousSundries_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_SorcerousSundries_1.text: Baldur's Gate prices, though. Not worth it, if you ask me.

Shadowheart_SorcerousSundries_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_SorcerousSundries_0.text: I shall be careful not to ask you then, child.

Laezel_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_2.text: How curious. The shadow curse has not touched this place.

Laezel_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_1.text: And by the looks of it, its riches have gone unplundered.

Laezel_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Laezel_RebelHideoutMasonsGuild_0.text: A faultless observation, Lae'zel. Are all githyanki so quick to come to the essential point?

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: You confound me, Wyll. You have all the illustrious iniquities of a warlock, and you choose to impress your partner with dancing?

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: Well I'm hardly going to say 'oh come here, have a hug in the arms of Hadar'.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: I may not weep for my home, but I would take a mushroom over a flower any day.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: I would have said I admire fungi as well.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: Until I met such a thing you call a Myconid.

Karlach_AbandonedCistern_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Karlach_AbandonedCistern_0.text: This place is foul. Drow would not tolerate rivers of waste flowing so close to their residences.

Karlach_AbandonedCistern_4.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_AbandonedCistern_4.text: You've got slaves to manage your sanitation. Baldur's Gate doesn't. Though we do rely quite heavily on kobolds.

Karlach_AbandonedCistern_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Karlach_AbandonedCistern_3.text: But surely the kobolds are slaves?

Karlach_AbandonedCistern_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Karlach_AbandonedCistern_1.text: Straj. Yet one more reason to despair for the fate of this city.
Karlach_AbandonedCistern_1.context: NodeContext: disappointed to learn ANOTHER miserable fact about Baldur's Gate - which is FAR inferior in her mind to great drow cities

Shadowheart_Wyrmway_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_Wyrmway_0.text: What sweet relief to shelter from the sky for a while.

Shadowheart_Wyrmway_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Wyrmway_2.text: Sunlight giving you a headache? You're not supposed to stare right into it, you know.

Shadowheart_Wyrmway_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Shadowheart_Wyrmway_1.text: That was due to your insipid conversation, half-elf.

Astarion_LastLightCursed_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_LastLightCursed_0.text: Devoured by the darkness. They should have retreated while they had the chance.
Astarion_LastLightCursed_0.context: NodeContext: witnessing Last Light, fallen into darkness, the Harpers all taken. She's chilled, but not at all sad. She didn't like them

Astarion_LastLightCursed_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_LastLightCursed_1.text: And yet here we stand. We're either very clever or very lucky.

Astarion_LastLightCursed_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_LastLightCursed_2.text: You do not need luck to survive, Astarion. Not when you have me.
Astarion_LastLightCursed_2.context: NodeContext: Proud and a little bit condescending

Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.text: You allowed that smith to meddle with your heart, Karlach, simply so you can be touched?

Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.text: Better to shut off the carnal desires than indulge them. They are distractions.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.text: Yes, because every function comes with a handy switch.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.text: Next time I'm injured, don't heal, just turn me off and on again.

Astarion_CazadorsPalace_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_2.text: Ominous, yet austere. This place has its charms.
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_2.context: NodeContext: admiring the decor in a vampire's home

Astarion_CazadorsPalace_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_1.text: We're both learning a lot. Cazador kept this place all to himself.

Astarion_CazadorsPalace_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_0.text: I do not blame him. It is not the sort of place servants or spawn should sully with their presence.
Astarion_CazadorsPalace_0.context: NodeContext: responding to Astaroin who is sulking he never saw this part of the house - Minthara mocks him
